text: Jambinai () are a Korean avant-rock band formed in Seoul in 2009. Their debut album Différance won the award for Best Crossover Album at the 2013 Korean Music Awards. Their second album Hermitage was released in 2016 on Bella Union. During the 2018 Winter Olympics closing ceremony in Pyeongchang, Jambinai performed with an orchestra of geomungo players. == Musical style == Jambinai are known for combining rock music instrumentation (drums, bass guitar, electric guitar) with the use of traditional Korean folk music instruments (haegeum, piri, geomungo). Furthermore, they have been compared to bands like Explosions in the Sky, Godspeed You! Black Emperor, and Mogwai. == Members == * Kim Bo-mi – haegeum * Lee Il-woo – electric guitar, piri, taepyeongso, vocals * Sim Eun-yong – geomungo ;Touring musicians * Ryu Myung- Hoon – drums * Choi Jae-hyuk – drums * Ok Ji-hoon – bass guitar * Yu Byeong- koo – bass guitar 20160708-Rudolstadt-Festival-Jambinai-9413.jpg|Kim Bo-mi playing the haegeum 20160708-Rudolstadt-Festival-Jambinai-9412.jpg|Lee Il-woo playing the taepyeongso Jambinai (27084050331).jpg|Shim Eun-young playing the geomungo == Discography == ;Studio albums * Différance (album, 2012) on GMC Records * Hermitage (album, 2016) on Bella Union * ONDA (album, 2019) on Bella Union ;EPs * Jambinai (ep, 2010) on GMC Records == Awards and nominations == {| class="wikitable" !Year !Award !Category !Nominated work !Result !Ref. |- | rowspan="2" |2013 | rowspan="6" |Korean Music Awards | Best Crossover Album | rowspan="2" |Différance | | |- | Best Jazz & Crossover Performance | | |- | 2015 | Committee Choice Special Award | | | |- | 2017 | rowspan="2" |Best Rock Album | Hermitage | | |- | rowspan="2" |2020 | ONDA | | rowspan="2" | |- | Best Rock Song | "ONDA" | |- |} ==References== == External links == *Jambinai official Facebook *Jambinai page at Bella Union Category:South Korean alternative rock groups Category:South Korean folk rock groups Category:Post- rock groups Category:Musical groups established in 2009 Category:2009 establishments in South Korea Category:Bella Union artists
title: Jambinai
